title: Synthetic Recap
body:
DALLAS – On a night when history was measured one impossible shot at a time, Wesley Person did not merely beat the Dallas Mavericks. He authored a masterpiece, a performance for the ages that culminated in a breathtaking 109-108 victory for the Phoenix Suns.

The final score was a formality. The real story was etched in the box score next to Person’s name: 46 points. In a grinding, defensive battle, Person was an unstoppable offensive force, a sharpshooter who turned the game into his personal showcase. While his teammates struggled to find their rhythm, Person was the rhythm, carrying the Suns' offensive load with a breathtaking display of scoring prowess.

Dallas, led by a gritty 22-point effort from Michael Finley, fought tooth and nail. They answered every Suns run, believing they had the formula to contain Phoenix. But there is no formula for a man possessed. Person rained down points from every conceivable angle, his shooting stroke pure and his determination unbreakable. The Mavericks threw every defender they had at him, but on this night, it was simply not enough.

The final seconds were a heart-pounding crescendo befitting such a historic individual effort. With the game on the line, it was only fitting that the ball found its way to the one man who had carried his team all night. Person delivered the final, decisive blows, sealing both the victory and his place in the annals of a classic regular-season duel.

In the end, the Phoenix Suns left Dallas with a narrow, hard-fought win. But Wesley Person left with something far greater: a legendary 46-point night that will be remembered long after the final buzzer.
